content.title: Align
content.text:
`\align` [`direction`] { }
 ### Options
 - `direction` =
   - `horizontal` (Default)
   - `vertical`
   - `h` (Short for `horizontal)`
   - `v` (Short for `vertical`)
 ### Usage
 - `\align` [`v`] { content } Aligns and centers 'content' vertically
 - `\align` [`h`] { content } Aligns and centers 'content' horizontally

content.title: Block
content.text:
`\block` { }
 ### Options
 None
 ### Usage
 - `\block` { 'content' } Holds 'content' just as the root document does, used when removing alignments or grouping content

content.title: Bold
content.text:
`\bold` { }

`\b` { } (Short for `\bold`)
 ### Options
 None
 ### Usage
 - `\bold` { text } 'text' will be displayed in bold font

content.title: Box
content.text:
`\box` [`color`] { }
 ### Options
 - `color` =
   - Color determined by theme (Default)
   - Hex color values in the format `#ffffff`
   - RGB values in the format `rgb(255,255,255)`
    - Color by name etc: `purple` or `white`
 ### Usage
 - `\box` [`white`] { content } creates a white box that contains 'content'

content.title: Center
content.text:
`\center` { }
 ### Options
 None
 ### Usage
 - `\center` { content } Aligns 'content' to the center, vertically and horizontally

content.title: Fill
content.text:
`\fill`
 ### Options
 None
 ### Usage
 - `\fill` An empty element that fills the containing element in the alignment direction, can be used to evenly space elements in an alignment

content.title: Header
content.text:
`\h1` [`underline`] { } (Title)

`\h2` [`underline`] { } (Section header)

`\h3` [`underline`] { } (Subsection header)
 ### Options
 - `underline` =
   - false (Default)
   - true
 ### Usage
 - `\h1` [`true`] { text } 'text' will be displayed as a title with an underline, creates a line break
 - `\h2` [`false`] { text } 'text' will be displayed as a section header, creates a line break

content.title: Line
content.text:
`\line`
 ### Options
 None
 ### Usage
 - `\line` Draws a line separator, the direction depends on the current element alignment

content.title: Image
content.text:
`\image` [`href`, `width`, `border`]
 ### Options
 - `href` =
   - External url `https://...`
 - `width` =
   - CSS units (`px`, `%`, `cm` etc), `100%` (default)
 - `border` =
   - false (Default)
   - true
 ### Usage
 - `\border` [`https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/2x/googlelogo_light_color_92x30dp.png`] Displays the external google logo

content.title: Link
content.text:
`\link` [`href`] { }

 `\linkTitle` [`fileId`]

 `\linkContent` [`fileId`, `border`]
 ### Options
 - `href` =
   - External url: `https://...`
   - Story file/document id: `ffffffffffffffffffffffff`
 - `fileId` =
   - Story file/document id: `ffffffffffffffffffffffff`
 - `border` =
   - false (Default)
   - true
 ### Usage
 - `\link` [`https://www.google.com/`] { text } Displays 'text' as a link that redirects to the google home page
 - `\link` [`ffffffffffffffffffffffff`] { text } Displays 'text' as a link that redirects to the file
 - `\linkTitle` [`ffffffffffffffffffffffff`] Displays the title of the linked file
 - `\linkContent` [`ffffffffffffffffffffffff`] Displays a summary of the linked file's content. The file type determines how it is displayed

content.title: Margin
content.text:
`\margin` [`margin`] { }
 ### Options
 - `margin` =
   - CSS units (cm, mm, px, % etc), each direction can be specified separately, separated by spaces
   - Etc: `100%`, `10px`, `50% 5px`, `9px 8px 7px 6px` 
 ### Usage
 - `\margin` [`10px 5px 3px 2px`] { content } 'content' has a margin of `10px` on top, `5px` right, `3px` bottom, and `2px` left
 - `margin` [`10px`] { content } 'content' has a margin of `10px` on all sides

content.title: Newline
content.text:
`\newline`

 `\n` (Short for newline)
 ### Options
 None
 ### Usage
 - `\n` insets a line break

content.title: Roll
content.text:
`\roll` [`dice`, `num`, `mod`, `mode`]
 ### Options
 - `dice` =
   - The size of the dice to use, must be an integer value greater than 0, `20` (Default)
 - `num` = 
   - The number of dice to roll, must be an integer value greater than 0, `1` (Default)
 - `mod` =
   - The fixed modifier applied, must be an integer value, `0` (Default)
 - `mode` =
   - `dice` (Default if `dice` â‰  20)
   - `mod` (Default if `dice` = 20)
   - `dmg`
 ### Usage
 - `\roll` [`10`, `num`: `2`, `mod`: `-1`] Draws a dice roll element with the text `2d10 - 1` displayed, and has the following context menu choices: 'Flat', 'Advantage', and 'Disadvantage'
 - `\roll` [`12`, `num`: `3`, `mod`: `1`, `mode`: `dmg`] Draws a dice roll figure with the text `3d12 + 1` displayed, and has the following context choices: 'Flat', and 'Crit'
 - `\roll` [`mod`: 1] Draws a dice roll figure with the text `+1` displayed, and has the following context choices: 'Flat', 'Advantage', and 'Disadvantage'

content.title: Save
content.text:
`\margin` [`margin`] { }
 ### Options
 - `margin` =
   - CSS units (cm, mm, px, % etc), each direction can be specified separately, separated by spaces
   - Etc: `100%`, `10px`, `50% 5px`, `9px 8px 7px 6px` 
 ### Usage
 - `\margin` [`10px 5px 3px 2px`] { content } 'content' has a margin of `10px` on top, `5px` right, `3px` bottom, and `2px` left
 - `margin` [`10px`] { content } 'content' has a margin of `10px` on all sides

content.title: Set
content.text:
`\set` [`identifier`] { value }
 ### Options
 - `identifier` =
   - The name of the variable to assign a value to
 ### Usage
 - `\set` [`var`] { test } Sets the variable `$var` to 'test'

content.title: Toggle
content.text:
`\toggle` [`content`, `alt`, `state`]
 ### Options
 - `content` =
   - The name of the variable to display if `state` = `false`
 - `alt` =
   - The name of the variable to display if `state` = `true`
 - `state` =
   - `false` (Default)
   - `true`
 ### Usage
 - `\toggle` [`a`, `alt`: `b`] Displays the content of variable `$a` and when clicked swaps to display the content of variable `$b`
